Summary: ► Enterprise / Large Corporates I help CIOs, CTOs and Senior Managers who are struggling to understand how to adapt to the ever-changing world of IT and how it impacts their OT landscape.   I do this by understanding three things about your business: ● Strategy - I look at what your business is trying to achieve in the short and medium term (irrespective of IT), before understanding how your IT strategy and roadmap fits with that vision. ● IT and OT - I look at your existing IT and OT landscapes (your 'As-Is'), clarify the technological capabilities that exist in both those domains and highlight where you have potential gaps.  I then help you prepare for the future with a clear plan and roadmap based on current risks as well as opportunities for enhancement, efficiency, and growth (your 'To-Be'). ► SMEs I help SMEs who create products for these sectors to get a better view on how to integrate their products into large corporate ('enterprise') IT environments. Enterprise IT can be very complex, with numerous technology standards and information management/security policies which often do not manifest elsewhere.  Many manufacturing / energy products are built with highly specialised functions in mind, not adherence to a plethora of IT guidelines which can vary from client to client. With decades of experience in enterprise IT, I can advise and assist on the technical integration of your solutions into larger clients, either on a per project basis or as a trusted advisor.

Summary: I have always loved learning. There’s an intoxicating rush of endorphins as you feel neurons firing in your brain and the world starts to make a little more sense.  But when I got a job and started workplace training, I hated it. It was soul-destroying drudgery. It breaks my heart that something that should be so fun had all the qualities of a beige sock. I’ve made it my life’s mission to eradicate dull online learning.  Brain science holds the key to understand what learning should look like. And the research shows that learning should be a fun, personalised and social experience.  That’s why I founded Growth Engineering! We create learning solutions shaped by pioneering research into brain science that build knowledge-sharing communities of learners who habitually return to complete training content and share their insight.  This, combined with gamification, leads to unprecedented levels of engagement and inspires learners to change their behaviour in service of their organisation’s mission. The result is learning technology that delivers extraordinary business impact. It’s no wonder we’ve been awarded over 100+ Global awards since 2013!

Summary: In April 2020, just as the pandemic was taking hold, we started up StackStudio Digital (and lately a few other satellite orgs under our Group of 21C Digital Holdings) with a modest initial investment, a clear roadmap for client services ensured with additional funding and with a lot of ambition! It is now the latter part of 2021, and we have come some distance from those days. We closed our very first year with revenues of c. £2 Million, and are now trending towards almost 4X that figure in this financial year. We must be doing something right to see this kind of client community support.   We started off this journey trying to reimagine how the Tech Recruiting and Services business works (or not!) in the UK. As Founders with deep and long experience in the UK market for over 20+ years, we decided to offer something different. Our initial focus was (and still is) on servicing the substantive demand for digital front end work – the Full Stack development segment supported by capability on Cloud, Data and Cyber Security. Hence the Firm’s name signalling a boutique orientation, with StackStudio Digital. As we added a number of clients in our Year 1, we began hearing about the support they needed on the broader CRM and CX needs – how to embrace CX/CRM the right way, and the quintessential question of whether to do this with a market-leading platform or just do best-of-breed solutions.  This focus – on Digital Enabling our clients’ CX/CRM needs – is going to be our raison d'etre for the future!  Today, we run a fairly global operation – our team of Researchers, Recruiters and Key Account Managers are based in India and Philippines, while our Cloud, Cyber and Data Consultants and Architects, Salesforce Experts and Sales team are based in the UK.  Get in touch if you wish to talk about your tech challenges, or if you are thinking of joining us!

Kevin was then appointed CEO Nordics, CEO Asia, and then UK Board member at Logica, the UK's largest IT systems integrator and outsourcer. His first role was as Managing Director for Northern Europe.  After growing that Region rapidly, Kevin was appointed Group General Manager. Summary: Are you a business owner running a £1m-£60m+ company and considering retirement?  Have you contemplated selling up, but are unsure of your exit strategy?  Perhaps you’ve thought about finding an investor to help you get to the next level of turnover and you need help with the ins and outs of doing this.  As a business buyer and mergers & acquisitions specialist with eight years’ experience helping business owners ready to sell or seek investment opportunities, I can help.  I started my finance career in the late 1990s working as a consultant for various top ten London law firms. I then moved into consulting, and worked at boutique investment firm Mansford Holdings. It was during this time that I gained a deep understanding of the investment world. I discovered exciting investment strategies, and ultimately became interested in portfolio investments and acquisitions.  The M&A industry has a reputation for being notoriously unscrupulous, and I wanted to rebel against this. Consequently, Verdani Investments was born.  We are a team of unequivocally straight-talking investors who pride ourselves on our ethical approach to M&A. We align ourselves with our clients’ goals, and only buy or invest if we genuinely believe in the company’s objectives.  So how does it work?  First of all we’ll discuss your business performance and objectives and, if it aligns with us, we’ll ask for your last three years of accounts from which we make a valuation assessment.  Next, we propose a structure for purchasing or investing in your business.  The final step is the buying of or investment in the business.  We help our clients feel confident and positive about their impending exit strategy. We give them the tools to release cash from the company and, ultimately, figure out their own path to wealth.   If this sounds like something you’re interested in, just drop me a DM on LinkedIn or email me on lee@verdaniinvestments.co.uk – you can also visit my website at www.verdaniinvestments.co.uk for further info.

Summary: How are you protecting your premises right now as lockdown eases? My company can bring you cameras that spot signs of Covid-19 to make sure you are warned.  We can do this for: •	Offices •	Warehouses •	Schools •	Health centres •	Any other premises where hygiene and safety are paramount  Our cameras are similar to those at Heathrow Airport identifying travellers infected with Coronavirus. We are providing these cameras nationwide. Anyone arriving at a premises fitted with the cameras are scanned by cameras designed to screen for high temperatures and signs of a fever. These include your •	Visitors •	Customers  •	Employees If anyone passing through has a high temperature or fever, the system will trigger a warning which is displayed on screen. The camera can take just a second to detect someone’s skin-surface temperature and can scan more than one person at a time, all these being achieved without any physical contact. We manage more than 500 car parks across the UK.  Clients include NHS Trusts, McDonalds and National Express. Now, following calls from former health secretary Jeremy Hunt for temperature checking to become part of daily life after lockdown, we are helping make that happen.   “Our team is trained to install and set up the cameras. Summary: I was really lucky that my parents were able to empower me to become a fully integrated, independent adult even though I have a serious disability. It all began before I was two when they built me a new kind of powerchair to give me the same level of mobility as other children at that stage: to free me first to be a toddler, so that each developmental step was right there ahead to seize throughout my childhood. They succeeded. I was 'The Wheelchair Toddler'. I am now passionate about making sure that that is still available to every disabled child born now. No patronising compromise. I meet parents who, like my own parents way back when, are not ready to give up their dreams and ambitions for their child just yet. Dragonmobility's vision is to see every disabled person fully integrated in the mainstream world in a practical way.  I don't think there's any experience I've had in my education and career that I don't call upon in my current work. I use my law degree and my corporate finance experience as much as I use my child development GCSE! Running an engineering workshop is much like my theatre production days - it's about bringing everything together behind the scenes to create exquisite moments of joy. We are a not-for-profit which competes with large international corporations; we know every child by name and build them a machine that fits with their (often quite tricky) body, and we provide the expertise of over 30 years to their parents to make that work and keep it working as they grow. We are looking to the child's future: not a medicalised future, but a life and a career and a family and all the things those parents always dreamed of. We need the support of the people who also believe in children's futures. You can help by supporting us at www.patreon.com/dragonmobility

Summary: Too many B2B professional services firms are reliant upon repeat business and referrals as their only sources of new business. This is stifling their growth potential.  Typically, they don't want to market. Thy just want clients to come and buy! When they do realise they need to market, they soon find out that they don’t have the expertise in-house or the time to build it. Most often they find this out the hard way by trying to do it themselves! Or, they’ve already tried to market their business but been let down by the marketing people and companies that they turned to for help. I see this A LOT! The problem is a lot of people think marketing is about them!  Their services. Their people. Their business history.  But you know what? No-one cares! If that stuff is relevant at all, it’s in the sales process, not marketing. Good marketing starts with focusing on the problems and opportunities that your ideal clients face.  Good marketing is about getting known, building trust, and generating leads.  Good marketing is about taking your prospects on a journey from being oblivious, to understanding that they’re afflicted, to being informed such that they know you can help.  And to do that effectively you need omni-channel marketing. You need traditional marketing and digital marketing. Heck, there's no such thing as 'digital marketing' anymore because everything is digital! At The B2B Marketer this is what we do for you. We help you to get known, build trust, and generate leads. And we do that by starting with Marketing Strategy, then we look at what the right tactics will be.  You can learn about our approach to marketing - which we call The Pyramid of Trust - here: https://theb2bmarketer.com/how-to-create-your-marketing-strategy/ Or you can cut to the chase and click on the phone box picture below to schedule a call with one of the team. (or copy this link into your browser: https://theb2bmarketer.com/schedule-a-call/)

Summary: DRS Bond Management is an acknowledged leader in surety broking, formed with the single-minded objective of delivering a state of the art approach to bond management and surety advisory services. Precision defines DRS, providing certainty to clients through an exacting, reliable and responsive focus. DRS is the trusted surety advisor to leading names in the construction and engineering sectors, as well as other companies in multiple sectors. Bringing together deep expertise in corporate governance and surety broking, gained from some of the world’s leading public companies and broking organisations, the DRS team combines these complimentary skill sets to enable clients to utilise surety to create lasting competitive and financial advantage. Through rigorous management training and a dedication to professional development, DRS remains at the forefront of the growth and application of surety. Detailed discovery of requirements, thorough surety market examination and the issue of accurate documentation, DRS delivers. From first contact to final contract, DRS is dedicated to a commitment to clear communication that supports client understanding. Timing is everything; facility capacity is critical and DRS supports clients in managing their bond capacity parallel with contract completions, ensuring that the ability to bond forthcoming immediate contracts is never compromised. DRS offers first class access to ‘investment grade’ (minimum A- Standard & Poor’s rating or equivalent) surety capacity delivered by the world’s leading sureties. DRS arranges surety solutions for a vast range of bonding needs, including: Performance Bonds; Retention Bonds; Advance Payment Bonds; Highways Bonds; National House Building Council (“NHBC”) Bonds; Bid Bonds; Duty Deferment Bonds; Rural Payment Agency (“RPA”) Bonds; Waste Resources Action Programme (“WRAP”) Bonds; Transfrontier Shipment of Waste Bonds; Restoration Bonds; Letter of Credit (“LOC”) Replacement Guarantees.

Summary: WHAT WE DO: We provide sales & marketing services for manufacturers, distributors and retailers for: customer returns, refurbished and overstock items. HOW WE DO IT: Everyone has hard-to-sell slow moving stock for which the sales department has lost the will to market & sell. Sometimes these goods are massively discounted (even below cost) just to resolve 'the problem'. However, you should consider another option: contracting an outsourced sales company just for these products. You have no costs involved as you pay only after the sale has been done. Our buyer portfolio has over 67,500  qualified buyers from all over the world. We already handle a portfolio of 35 vendors on behalf of whom we promote & sell millions of £ worth of stock. Our vendors highly appreciate our services and leave us handling the hassle of sales while they focus on their core business. We became part of their team and they consult us on strategic decisions. Everyone works from wherever they are in the world. We hire people regardless of where they are. OUR STORY: I founded ARLL in 2011 after I was looking for an outsourced sales service company and I couldn't find it.  We now have folks in just over 30 countries. This has been amazing for the company in that we can attract and retain the best talent without them having to be in UK. So far this model has worked extraordinarily well, and we plan to continue it Our sales agents speak multiple languages – so there is a high chance to get someone speaking your language –and assist you during the sales process – without the risk of being lost in translation. Spoken languages: English, French, German, Italian, Arabic, Bulgarian, Russian, Romanian, Spanish TRUE FACTS ABOUT ME: I am a Romanian business woman in a business where 99% of the companies are managed by men and many of them have have misconceptions about my nationality. Summary: Throughout her decade-long career, Immy has focused on convening and building community, the role of citizens in radical systemic change, and how we together create more democratic, distributed, open source social and civic infrastructure. Through this work she has discovered much about economic justice and broader injustices, the pivotal role of land and social/civic infrastructure in neighbourhoods, and the value extracted from communities through our broken investment models. It’s an ongoing journey of discovery, emergence and learning together.  Immy is a Co - Founder and Director of CIVIC SQUARE. CIVIC SQUARE is a public square, neighbourhood lab, and creative + participatory platform focused on regenerative civic and social infrastructure within neighbourhoods. Immy is part of a creative and dynamic leadership team who work alongside the local neighbourhood, to offer a bold approach to visioning, building and investing in civic infrastructure for neighbourhoods of the future.  She is also an active member of Project 00, the Resourcing Racial Justice Coalition, and the National Lottery Community Fund Advisory Fund. Immy is part of the Doughnut Economics Action Lab Advisory Team, a Birmingham Hippodrome Trustee, a Birmingham Open Media (BOM) Board Member and an Inclusive Economy Partnership Board Champion. Immy was a founding director of Impact Hub Birmingham, which was open between 2015 - 2019. Impact Hub Birmingham was on a mission to help build a fairer more equal and just city, through people place and open movements. On a voluntary basis, Immy also led and ran TEDxBRUM between 2012 and 2017. Immy’s work has been recognised with a series of notable honours and awards. In 2018, Impact Hub Birmingham was named a NESTA New Radical. For her services to the city of Birmingham, Aston University’s School of Life & Heath Sciences granted Immy an Honorary Doctorate in 2019.  And in 2020, Immy was awarded a prestigious Ashoka Fellowship.

Summary: Following a career leading large and complex financial services businesses in Australia, Asia, the UK and US, now I mainly  point people in the right direction and give support along the way.   I work with startups and established businesses on their sales strategy and implementation, to help them expand their businesses, locally and across borders, and to push forward in terms of expansion of products, territories, or innovations. I do this as an advisor and mentor, or non-executive director. For example, I am on the advisory board of the Fine Art Bourse.  I advise on technical and financial business decisions and processes and I also make relevant and useful introductions and build connections across global jurisdictions on behalf of my clients. One of the things I have noticed with entrepreneurs is that it’s really lonely, especially at the startup phase (but not exclusively!). Entrepreneurs must be very versatile and agile – with a great idea, a healthy amount of optimism, a belief in their product, an open mind, and a willingness to grow. They want more than advice. They want to have a conversation or “pick a brain” with someone who won’t judge, who has experience and where there are no risks or hidden agendas. I am constantly surprised which parts people find valuable out of each conversation. Over the past few years I have performed a number of interim independent, non-executive roles at operational and board levels. I do pro-bono mentoring for post-grad students at LSE and Regents University and am involved in the entrepreneurial schools in those universities.

Summary: In today's busy workplace it is not unusual for managers and their teams to feel like their workload has tipped into impossible and that they are drowning in deadlines. Constant change, uncertainty and a difficult work environment may make you feel out of control and you may be asked to do more and more with less and less.  Chronic stress leads to significant neurological strain which means our performance drops, we feel disillusioned and exhausted. Dr Rachel Morris is a GP who knows what it is like to feel overwhelmed, exhausted and on the edge of burnout. She believes that it should be possible to thrive both in work and life and that you shouldn't have to choose between working and being happy.  Rachel has created the Shapes Toolkit® to help busy professionals and their teams to beat stress and thrive at work through increasing their wellbeing, helping them take control of their time and prioritise their work and have better conversations so that they can feel calm, in control and thrive in their workplace.  The Shapes Toolkit is an interactive and experiential course and helps managers and individuals to: •	Understand the neuroscience of stress  •	Recognise signs and symptoms of stress in their teams  •	Create a good workplace •	Help teams increase their wellbeing •	Recognise and change their response to stressful events •	Manage their time and prioritise their workload •	Learn how to have coaching conversations to support behaviour change •	Empower their teams to be more proactive and take control Rachel also hosts the popular podcast You Are Not A Frog and is also Director of Leadership Courses for Red Whale (GP Update Ltd), a national Primary Care training organisation. She co-authored and delivers their flagship Leadership course, Lead. Manage. Thrive! for GPs, and those working in primary care and travels around the country delivering these courses to diverse groups of Primary Care Professionals She has a wide experience in education having worked for 13 years as Assistant Director for GP Studies at the School of Clinical Medicine, University of Cambridge. She then developed and led their new Professionalism Course until 2017. Having left to concentrate on post-graduate leadership development, she continues at Cambridge University as a Tutor for the PG Certificate in Medical Education. She regularly speaks at conferences on topics such as 'How to be happy at work', 'Staying mentally healthy at work' and  'How to conflict without the drama' and runs workshops and training days around the Shapes Toolkit.
Title: Keynote speaker, host of You Are Not A Frog podcast, GP, Executive Coach and Trainer

Summary: I am Professor of Sleep Medicine in the Nuffield Department of Clinical Neurosciences (NDCN), University of Oxford where I founded the Experimental & Clinical Sleep Medicine research programme in the Sleep & Circadian Research Institute (SCNi) and I am Clinical Director of the Oxford Online Programme in Sleep Medicine  (https://www.ndcn.ox.ac.uk/study/graduate-students/online-programme-in-sleep-medicine). I am a Fellow of Somerville College, Oxford and a Senior Research Fellow in the University Department of Psychiatry. I qualified as a Clinical Psychologist in 1980, and over the years have held many NHS clinical and academic positions in the UK. Before moving to Oxford in 2013, I was founding Director of the University of Glasgow Sleep Centre (1995 - 2012), and I am an Emeritus Professor in the College of Medical, Veterinary and Life Sciences. I have held Visiting Professorships at prestigious institutions in Europe, USA, Canada and Australia. My expertise is in the clinical and laboratory assessment and treatment of sleep disorders, particularly using Cognitive Behavioural Therapeutics (CBTx), and in studies of the aetiology and maintenance of insomnia disorder. I am interested in the relationships between sleep and mental health and sleep and metabolic health. I have published over 300 scientific papers and written or edited numerous books. I co-founded Big Health/ Sleepio (www.bighealth.com) to make evidence based digital CBT (dCBT or 'digital medicine') scalable.  My grant support is from the Chief Scientist Office (Scotland), Cancer Research UK, National Institutes of Cancer Research, The Wellcome Trust, the Education Endowment Foundation, the NIHR/ HTA (in the UK) and NIH (in the USA).  I serve on the European Sleep Research Society (ESRS) Sleep Medicine and Sleep Education committees, and co-chair the ESRS CBT Academy. I am Deputy Editor for the Journal of Sleep Research; and serve on the Editorial Board of Sleep Medicine Reviews. I was appointed an Honorary Fellow of the BABCP (British Association for Behavioural & Cognitive Psychotherapies) in 2015, and was awarded the Mary A. Carskadon Outstanding Educator Award by the Sleep Research Society in 2017. I am a Fellow of the British Psychological Society, the Royal Society of Medicine, and the American Academy of Sleep Medicine. Over the years I have made regular contributions to public engagement with science on public service broadcasts, and in documentaries programmes on sleep and sleep disorders.
Title: Professor of Sleep Medicine

Summary: In Silico Genesis was founded in early 2011, primarily based on the work carried out in the Laboratory of Molecular Biophysics and the Structural Bioinformatics and Computational Biochemistry Unit, the Department of Biochemistry of the University of Oxford. The Medical Research Council provided the funding for the research and training undertaken, via MRC special training fellowship in Bioinformatics/Neuroinformatics/Health-Informatics, under a project title 'Ion channels and their regulatory interactions - a bioinformatics approach'.   In Silico Genesis does a target-driven translation for developing genomic medicine and companion diagnostics. The company has three portfolios in the production line at present, which has been made possible via in kind support provided by the Oxford Supercomputing Centre in the Oxford e Research Centre of the University of Oxford. In Silico Genesis has a target identified for three existing antimalarials in the market (malaria companion diagnostics), an antiviral combination therapy consisting of oligonucleotides and a repurposed drug for influenza A virus (biohazard level 2) and Crimean Congo Haemorrhagic Fever virus (biohazard level 4), and a three-component Alzheimer's therapy aided by a viral vector for delivery in the brain. The company operates in partnership with the Public Health England for our virus programme and is collaborating with Pharmacology, the University of Oxford for one of our Alzheimer's projects.  Specialties: Medical genomics, bioinformatics, medical statistics and biochemistry Kimberley of In Silico Genesis Limited (ISG) is thankful to Dr. Mark Treherne, Chief Executive of UK Trade and Investment (UKTI), Life Science Investment Organisation (LSIO) in Cambridge of England, for his unshakable confidence and trust since the year of foundation of In Silico Genesis. URL:  http://www.insilicogenesis.com (previously, http://www.insilicogenesis.co.uk)
